name: P2Pool on Raspberry Pi
tagline: Low Latency and Low Power Consumption P2Pool
body:
# I'm creating P2Pools that can run on a [Raspberry Pi](http://amzn.to/1peyhoc)!

***

To get started you will need to do a little shopping:

* [Raspberry Pi B+](http://amzn.to/1peyhoc)
* [Raspberry Pi B+ Case](http://amzn.to/1peyKqq) - Others will do, but this is cheap and well made.
* [Power Supply](http://amzn.to/1peyQOT)
* [SDHC Micro SD Card](http://amzn.to/1peyWWC)
* [Ethernet Cable](http://amzn.to/Y0C6YY) - Recommended.
* [WiFi Dongle](http://amzn.to/Y0C9UD) - Not recommended, but if your only choice.

***

Install Raspbian with floating point support from the [Raspberry Pi](http://www.raspberrypi.org/downloads/) website.

You now have everything you need to start making your P2Pool. Check the main [GitHub](https://github.com/P2PoolOnPi) and choose your chosen P2Pool to build.

***

Donations to this project are always welcome. Especially as building new pools costs for equipment and time.

* Donations in Doge: DFsJtx8YCVd8fuWj5GFijYcg3RfvZnDd7v
